attributes.action: Scrap working benefits in favour of a living minimum wage and a fair tax system.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Currently the government supplements low waged people's income with public money. This is in effect a subsidy for business at the expense of the public purse.

It is wrong that someone should work a full week and still have to claim benefits to survive. On the contrary, if someone works all week they should not only be able to have a decent standard of living but also make a net contribution to the tax system. 

This situation must be remedied by a "living" minimum wage coupled to a fair tax system. We would suggest that the minimum wage should be at least £8 per hour and that in general workers should be able to earn at least £10,000 tax free.
